de.feig
Class FeUsb

java.lang.Object
  de.feig.FeUsb

public final class FeUsb
extends java.lang.Object

This is the main class to manage the USB. With its methods, you can connect and disconnect USB devices.

You should create only one run-time object in every application.

For more information about FeUsb please refer to the manual of FEUSB.DLL (H00501-xe-ID-B).

FeUsb

public FeUsb()
      throws FePortDriverException
constructor

Throws:
FePortDriverException -

Description:
If a problem occured an exception is thrown. The class FeUsb contains a list of all created USB reader objects. Thus, you should create only one run-time object of FeUsb in every application.

scan

public int scan(int scanOption,
                FeUsbScanSearch scanSearch)
         throws FePortDriverException
Detecting a single or all USB readers.

Parameters:
scanOption - for more details of this parameter look at the description field
scanSearch - see FeUsbScanSearch
Returns:
an integer with scan list index (>= 0) or error code (<0)

Description:
With this method the USB port is searched for readers with the FEIG identifier, and each found reader is entered in the internal scan list. The parameter scanOption allows searching for one or all readers, or allows no longer existing readers to be deleted from the scan list. The index of the scan list is null-based. The parameter FeUsbScanSearch scanSearch is used for targeted searching with the option FeUsbConst.SCAN_SEARCH. If this option is not used, null must be passed.
The parameter scanOption controls the scan procedure and is comprised of scanOption = [CommandID] | [OptionID] | [OptionID].
CommandIDs:
  • FeUsbScanSearch.SCAN_FIRST searches for the reader that was the first one to be registered by the operating system. The internal scan counter is thus set to 0. The scan list is cleared before the scanning process.
  • FeUsbScanSearch.SCAN_NEXT searches for the reader that was next registered by the operating system. For this the internal scan counter is used, which is incremented with each successful FeUsbScanSearch.SCAN_NEXT (up to max. 127). Note: each FeUsbScanSearch.FEUSB_SCAN_FIRST resets the internal scan counter to 0!
  • FeUsbScanSearch.SCAN_NEW searches for a new readers which is not yet entered in the scan list. Te internal counter is correspondingly set anew.
  • FeUsbScanSearch.SCAN_ALL allows searching for all readers on the USB port. The scan counter is correspondingly set anew. The scan list is first cleared and then reconstructed. You cannot therefore assume that a reader previously entered in the scan list will be listed with the same index.
  • FeUsbScanSearch.SCAN_PACK deletes all readers from the internal scan list which are no longer found on the USB port.
OptionIDs:
  • FeUsbScanSearch.SCAN_SEARCH searches for a specific reader on the USB port. You enter the search options in the parameter scanSearch. This OptionID must always be linked to a CommandID.
  • FeUsbScanSearch.SCAN_PACK deletes all devices from the internal scan list which are no longer found on the USB port. The option is only used if the previous (optional) scan was without error. Caution: this option changes the list index for the already entered readers! This option can be combined with all others. But for the CommandID FeUsbScanSearch.SCAN_ALL this is superfluous, since this automatically reconstructs the scan list.

Throws:
FePortDriverException

scanAndOpen

public int scanAndOpen(int scanOption,
                       FeUsbScanSearch scanSearch)
                throws FePortDriverException
Detecting a single or all USB readers and then opening the channels.

Parameters:
scanOption - for more details of this parameter look at the description field
scanSearch - see FeUsbScanSearch
Returns:
device handle (> 0) or error code (<0)
Description:
This method combines the method scan and openDevice. This method is useful for directly opening a channel to a reader in the frequently occurring case where exactly one OBID� reader is found on the USB port.
When an error has occurred some readers can be detected and the channel opened. After a scanAndOpen call using option FeUsbScanSearch.SCAN_ALL you should therefore always use getScanListSize() to check the size of the scan list.
See also: description of the scan method

Throws:
FePortDriverException

clearScanList

public void clearScanList()
Clears the scan list.
Description:
This method clears the scan list. Already opened USB reader objects are not automatically closed by this function. This means it is possible to perform a new scan to restore the scan list.

getScanListSize

public int getScanListSize()
Gets the size of the scan list.

Returns:
the number of data records in the scan list

Description:
This method is used to obtain the number of data records in the scan list.

getScanListPara

public java.lang.String getScanListPara(int index,
                                        java.lang.String parameterID)
                                 throws FePortDriverException
Reads a value from the scan list.

Parameters:
index - is the zero based index in scan list
parameterID - The parameter identifiers are:
Returns:

Description:
This method gives access to the values in the scan list. Each record contains several values for the found OBID� reader. Access is gained using the null-based index index
. The parameter parameterID indicates the identifier for the corresponding scan list value (see parameter Field).

"Device-ID" - Serial number of the USB device
"DeviceHnd" - Device handle for the USB channel
"FamilyName" - Name of the device family for the device on the USB channel
"DeviceName" - Name of the device on the USB channel
"Present" - USB device is connected or disconnected
Throws:
FePortDriverException

openDevice

public int openDevice(long deviceID)
               throws FePortDriverException
Opens a channel for communication with an OBID� reader.

Description:
The method opens a USB channel and internally creates a USB reader object for administering the channel parameters. The returned device handle identifies the channel from the outside.
deviceID is the serial number of the OBID� reader on the USB channel.
The method invoke is ended with an error if the serial number was not found in the scan list.
After successful opening, the device handle is also stored in the scan list and the ready flag set. Thus simply reading out the scan list allows you to determine which readers were found, are open and ready.
The USB channel opened with openDevice must (!) be closed using the method closeDevice(int deviceHandle). Otherwise the memory reserved by the library is not freed up again.
Repeated invoking of this method with the same serial number does not result in repeated opening of channels.

Parameters:
deviceID - is the serial number of the OBID� reader on the USB channel.
Returns:
device handle (> 0) or error code (<0)
Throws:
FePortDriverException

closeDevice

public int closeDevice(int deviceHandle)
                throws FePortDriverException
Closes a USB channel of an OBID� USB reader

Parameters:
deviceHandle - represents the USB reader
Returns:
0, if successful, otherwise <0

Throws:
FePortDriverException -
Description:
The method closes the USB channel specified by the parameter deviceHandle and frees up the reserved memory.

getDeviceList

public int getDeviceList(int deviceHandle)
                  throws FePortDriverException
Uses the parameter deviceHandle to get the first or following USB reader object from the internal list of the opened USB readers.

Description:
The method returns If you pass a 0 for deviceHandle, the first entry in the list will returned. If you use deviceHandle to pass a USB reader object kept in the list, the entry following the device handle is obtained and returned. In this way you can successively use the returned handle to go through the list from front to back.

Parameters:
deviceHandle - device handle returned by openDevice or scanAndOpen
Returns:
the device handle of the next USB reader object stored in the internal device list
Throws:
FePortDriverException
